intro: Leontodon ovinus, commonly known as the sheep's tooth, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces achenes as its fruits. Leontodon ovinus is often found in open habitats and is considered a characteristic species of certain grassland ecosystems.
